skill.name: code-formatter
skill.description: Automatically format code across multiple languages with opinionated configurations.
skill.summary: Automatically format code across multiple languages with opinionated configurations.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: All 14 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified metadata URLs as network threats, git tree hashes as C2 communication, and benign text descriptions (including tool names like Black and Prettier) as cryptographic algorithms. This is a prompt-only skill containing only AI instructions in SKILL.md with no executable code, file operations, network calls, or command execution.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent code formatting slows down code reviews and increases merge conflicts. This skill formats code across 10+ languages using opinionated best practices and existing project configurations.
actual_capabilities: Detect and format JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust, and Java code
Format CSS, SCSS, LESS, HTML, JSON, YAML, and Markdown files
Respect existing project formatting configurations like .prettierrc and .editorconfig
Apply language-specific best practices and popular style guides such as PEP 8
Report formatting changes and style decisions made during formatting
Check formatting without making changes to preview modifications
limitations: Does not execute external formatters like Prettier or Black directly
Provides AI instructions for conceptual code formatting
Cannot modify files on disk without separate file-writing capabilities
Does not install or configure formatter tools in your project

use_cases.title: Standardize team code style
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent formatting across a codebase following established style guides like PEP 8 and Google Style Guide.

use_cases.title: Quick format validation
use_cases.description: Check if code follows project style conventions and suggest formatting improvements during reviews.

use_cases.title: Match project conventions
use_cases.description: Format contributions to match the existing code style of an unfamiliar open source project.

prompt_templates.title: Format current directory
prompt_templates.scenario: Format all code in current project
prompt_templates.prompt: Format all code files in this directory using appropriate styles for each language detected.

prompt_templates.title: Format specific path
prompt_templates.scenario: Format files in a specific folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Format the src/ directory. Check for existing config files first and apply their rules.

prompt_templates.title: Check only mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Check code formatting without making changes. Report which files would be modified and what changes would be made.

prompt_templates.title: Format by language
prompt_templates.prompt: Format all Python files in this project using Black style. Respect pyproject.toml if present.

output: Added trailing commas to multi-line objects

output_examples.input: Format all Python files with check-only mode
output: Would add 234 trailing commas to multi-line definitions

best_practices: Let the skill detect existing config files first before applying defaults
Specify the target path or language when invoking the skill
Use check-only mode to preview changes before applying them
Respect .gitignore patterns to skip vendor and generated directories
anti_patterns: Running without checking for existing project configuration
Formatting entire vendor or node_modules directories
Expecting the skill to install formatter tools automatically
Using on binary or lock files without checking file type

faq.question: Which languages are supported?
faq.answer: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust, Java, CSS, SCSS, LESS, HTML, JSON, YAML, and Markdown.

faq.question: Does this install Prettier or Black?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt skill that instructs an AI on formatting concepts. You need separate tools installed.

faq.question: How does it handle project configs?
faq.answer: The skill checks for .prettierrc, .editorconfig, pyproject.toml, and other config files first.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only contains AI instructions. No files are read, written, or sent externally.

faq.question: Can it format specific file types only?
faq.answer: Yes. Use --language python or specify the language to format only matching files.

faq.question: How is this different from Prettier?
faq.answer: Prettier is a tool that formats files on disk. This skill provides AI prompts to apply formatting concepts.
